dog_expert.Description: A person that either lived in a household with dogs, owned one or several dogs, or has other significant expertise (e.g., from training or working with dogs)

perspective_taking.Description: the ability to interpret situations from the perspective of others
perspective_taking.Questionnaire: Questionnaire of Cognitive and Affective Empathy (Reniers et al., 2016)
perspective_taking.Units: arbitrary interval scale ranging from 1 to 4

online_simulation.Description: the ability to put oneself in another person’s place to understand and anticipate their feelings
online_simulation.Questionnaire: Questionnaire of Cognitive and Affective Empathy (Reniers et al., 2016)
online_simulation.Units: arbitrary interval scale ranging from 1 to 4

emotion_contagion.Description: the tendency to automatically take over others’ emotions
emotion_contagion.Questionnaire: Questionnaire of Cognitive and Affective Empathy (Reniers et al., 2016)
emotion_contagion.Units: arbitrary interval scale ranging from 1 to 4

proximal_responsivity.Description: the affective responsivity when observing others’ emotions in a more close social context
proximal_responsivity.Questionnaire: Questionnaire of Cognitive and Affective Empathy (Reniers et al., 2016)
proximal_responsivity.Units: arbitrary interval scale ranging from 1 to 4

peripheral_responsivity.Description: the affective responsivity when observing others’ emotions in a more detached context, e.g., when watching characters in a movie
peripheral_responsivity.Questionnaire: Questionnaire of Cognitive and Affective Empathy (Reniers et al., 2016)
peripheral_responsivity.Units: arbitrary interval scale ranging from 1 to 4

cognitive_empathy.Description: the ability to construct a working model of the emotional states of others
cognitive_empathy.Questionnaire: Questionnaire of Cognitive and Affective Empathy (Reniers et al., 2016)

affective_empathy.Description: the ability to be sensitive to and vicariously experience the feelings of others
affective_empathy.Questionnaire: Questionnaire of Cognitive and Affective Empathy (Reniers et al., 2016)
affective_empathy.Units: arbitrary interval scale ranging from 1 to 4

affection.Description: How much do you like dogs?

knowledge.Description: How much do you know about dog behaviour?

shared_household.Description: Have you ever shared or currently share a household with at least one dog?

shared_household_years.Description: Time spent living with at least one dog in same household

ownership.Description: Do you currently own a dog?

ownership_count.Description: How many dogs do you currently own?

expertise.Description: Do you have any experience in dog training or hobbies involving working with dogs (e.g. agility?)

expertise_years.Description: If expertise was answered with yes: For how many years?

expertise_open.Description: if expertise was answered with yes: What kind of experience do you have?
